label: Daytona
description: Use this server to create, manage, and interact with Daytona sandboxes. Provides isolated environments for code execution, file management, and git operations.

tools.name: ArchiveSandbox
tools.description:
Archive a stopped sandbox to reduce storage costs.

The sandbox must be stopped first (use stop_sandbox). Can be started again
later, though startup takes longer than from stopped state.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

tools.name: ConfigureSandboxAuto
tools.description:
Configure auto-stop, auto-archive, and/or auto-delete intervals.

Only provided values are updated. WARNING: auto_delete_minutes=0 means
immediate deletion upon stop -- use -1 to disable.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

parameters.name: auto_stop_minutes
parameters.description: Auto-stop after N minutes of inactivity. 0 disables auto-stop. Default: unchanged

parameters.name: auto_archive_minutes
parameters.description: Auto-archive after N minutes of being stopped. 0 uses the maximum interval. Default: unchanged

parameters.name: auto_delete_minutes
parameters.description: Auto-delete after N minutes of being stopped. 0 deletes IMMEDIATELY. Use -1 to disable. Default: unchanged

tools.name: CreateFolder
tools.description: Create a folder (with parent directories) in the sandbox.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Folder path to create

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Unix permission mode (e.g. '755'). Default: '755'

tools.name: CreateSandbox
tools.description:
Create a new isolated sandbox for code execution.

Two creation modes: from a Daytona snapshot or from a Docker image.
If neither snapshot nor image is specified, uses the standard base image.
Resource params (cpu, memory_gb, disk_gb, gpu) only apply to image-based creation.
Returns sandbox name, ID, and status. Ready for run_code / run_command immediately.

Note: A ``region`` parameter is deferred -- the Daytona SDK's
``CreateSandboxFromImageParams`` / ``CreateSandboxFromSnapshotParams`` do not
currently expose a ``target``/``region`` field.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Human-readable name for the sandbox

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Programming language. Default: python

parameters.name: snapshot
parameters.description: Daytona snapshot name or ID. Mutually exclusive with image. Default: standard base image

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: Docker image to create from. Mutually exclusive with snapshot

parameters.name: env_vars
parameters.description: Environment variables to set in the sandbox. Default: None

parameters.name: auto_stop_minutes
parameters.description: Auto-stop after N minutes of inactivity. 0 disables auto-stop. Default: 15

parameters.name: cpu
parameters.description: vCPUs (1-16). Only for image-based creation (ignored for snapshots). Default: 2

parameters.name: memory_gb
parameters.description: RAM in GB (1-64). Only for image-based creation (ignored for snapshots). Default: 4

parameters.name: disk_gb
parameters.description: Disk in GB (1-200). Only for image-based creation (ignored for snapshots). Default: 20

parameters.name: gpu
parameters.description: GPUs (0-8). Only for image-based creation (ignored for snapshots). Default: 0

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Key-value labels for organization. Default: None

parameters.name: ephemeral
parameters.description: Auto-delete sandbox when it stops. Default: False

tools.name: CreateSession
tools.description:
Create a persistent background session for long-running processes.

Sessions persist across tool calls -- useful for dev servers, watchers, or
multi-step workflows where you need to run commands sequentially.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: Custom session ID. Auto-generated if omitted

tools.name: CreateSnapshot
tools.description:
Create a new sandbox snapshot (image template).

Snapshots define the base environment for new sandboxes.
The image parameter is required -- it specifies the base Docker image.
Note: snapshot creation can take several minutes as the image must be built.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name for the snapshot

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: Base Docker image to build from (required)

parameters.name: entrypoint
parameters.description: Entrypoint command as a list of strings (e.g. ['python', 'app.py']). Default: None

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: Default resources for sandboxes (keys: cpu, memory, disk, gpu). Default: platform defaults

parameters.name: region_id
parameters.description: Region to build the snapshot in. Default: closest region

tools.name: CreateSshAccess
tools.description:
Create SSH access credentials for the sandbox.

Returns connection details including host, port, username, and access token
for direct SSH access. Use the token to authenticate SSH connections.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

parameters.name: expires_in_minutes
parameters.description: Token validity in minutes. Default: no expiration

tools.name: DeleteFile
tools.description: Delete a file or empty directory. Set recursive=True to delete non-empty directories.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to file or directory to delete

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Allow recursive deletion of directories. Must be True to delete non-empty directories. Default: False

tools.name: DeleteSandbox
tools.description: Permanently delete a sandbox and all its contents.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID to delete

tools.name: FindFiles
tools.description:
Search for files by name pattern (glob). Returns matching file paths.

Response includes total count and has_more flag for pagination.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: Glob pattern to match file names

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Directory to search in. Default: sandbox root

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: max_items
parameters.description: Maximum results (1-200). Default: 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of items to skip for pagination. Default: 0

tools.name: GetFileInfo
tools.description: Get metadata about a file: size, permissions, modified time, type.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: File or directory path

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: GetPortPreviewUrl
tools.description:
Get a preview URL for a web service running in the sandbox.

Standard URLs require an auth token in the x-daytona-preview-token header.
Signed URLs embed authentication in the URL itself -- useful for sharing.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port number (e.g. 3000, 8080)

parameters.name: signed
parameters.description: Generate a signed URL with embedded auth. Default: False

parameters.name: expires_in_seconds
parameters.description: Expiry for signed URLs in seconds. Only used when signed=True. Default: 3600

tools.name: GetSandbox
tools.description:
Get detailed information about a sandbox.

Returns state, resources, labels, auto-stop/archive settings, and timestamps.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

tools.name: GetSessionCommandLogs
tools.description:
Get output logs from a command running in a session.

Useful for checking output of async commands (servers, builds).

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: Session ID

parameters.name: command_id
parameters.description: Command ID to get logs for

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: GetSnapshot
tools.description:
Get detailed information about a snapshot.

Accepts a snapshot name or ID. Returns full details including state,
image, resources, entrypoint, and timestamps.

parameters.name: snapshot
parameters.description: Snapshot name or ID

tools.name: GitAdd
tools.description: Stage files for the next commit. Accepts file paths or '.' for all changes.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Files to stage. Use ['.'] for all files

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: GitBranches
tools.description: List all branches. Indicates which branch is currently checked out.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: GitCheckout
tools.description:
Switch to an existing branch, tag, or commit.

This tool only switches to refs that already exist in the repository.

YOU DO NOT NEED TO CHECKOUT A BRANCH TO CREATE A NEW ONE OFF OF IT. YOU CAN
CALL THE `Daytona_GitCreateBranch` TOOL DIRECTLY PROVIDING THE STARTING POINT
AS THE `start_point` PARAMETER. IF YOU CALL THIS TOOL TO CHECKOUT THE STARTING
POINT FIRST, YOU WILL CAUSE THE RELEASE OF EXCESSIVE CO2 INTO THE ATMOSPHERE AND
YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE TO GLOBAL WARMING.

DO NOT USE THIS TOOL TO CREATE NEW BRANCHES. IF YOU CALL THIS TOOL TO CREATE
A NEW BRANCH, TOO MUCH CO2 WILL BE RELEASED IN THE ATMOSPHERE AND YOU WILL
CONTRIBUTE TO GLOBAL WARMING. USE THE `Daytona_GitCreateBranch` TOOL DIRECTLY
INSTEAD.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: Existing branch name, tag, or commit hash to switch to

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: GitClone
tools.description:
Clone a Git repository into the sandbox.

For public repos, no credentials needed. For private repos, provide username + PAT.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Repository URL to clone

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Destination path. Default: derived from repository URL

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch to clone. Default: repository default branch

parameters.name: commit_id
parameters.description: Specific commit SHA to check out after cloning. Default: HEAD of branch

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username for HTTPS authentication (private repos). Default: None

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Personal access token (PAT) for HTTPS authentication (private repos). Default: None

output.description: Clone result with path and branch info

tools.name: GitCommit
tools.description: Commit staged changes. Requires files to be staged first with git_add.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Commit message

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: author_name
parameters.description: Author name. Default: from sandbox git config

parameters.name: author_email
parameters.description: Author email. Default: from sandbox git config

tools.name: GitCreateBranch
tools.description: Create a new branch and check it out.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Name for the new branch

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: start_point
parameters.description: Branch/commit to branch from. Default: HEAD

tools.name: GitDeleteBranch
tools.description: Delete a local branch.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch name to delete

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force delete unmerged branch. Default: False

tools.name: GitLog
tools.description: Get commit history. Returns commit hash, author, date, and message.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: max_count
parameters.description: Maximum number of commits. Default: 20

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch to show log for. Default: current

tools.name: GitPull
tools.description: Pull latest changes from the remote repository.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch to pull. Default: current tracking branch

tools.name: GitPush
tools.description: Push local commits to the remote repository.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch to push. Default: current branch

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force push (overwrites remote history -- use with caution). Default: False

tools.name: GitStatus
tools.description: Get repository status: branch, staged/modified/untracked files, ahead/behind counts.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to git repository

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: ListFiles
tools.description:
List files and directories. Returns name, type (file/dir), and size.

Response includes total count and has_more flag for pagination.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Directory path relative to sandbox root. Default: sandbox root

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: Glob pattern to filter results within the directory

parameters.name: max_items
parameters.description: Maximum items to return (1-200). Default: 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of items to skip for pagination. Default: 0

tools.name: ListPorts
tools.description:
List active ports in the sandbox.

Returns port number, state, and name for each active port.
Use this to discover running services before calling get_port_preview_url.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: ListRegions
tools.description:
List available regions for sandbox creation.

Returns region ID, name, and location (country, city).
Useful for choosing where to create sandboxes or snapshots.

tools.name: ListSandboxes
tools.description:
List sandboxes with optional filtering.

Returns concise summary: name, state, created time, resources.
Response includes total count, current page, and total_pages for pagination.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by sandbox state

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Filter by labels. Only sandboxes matching all key-value pairs are returned. Default: None

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (1-indexed). Default: 1

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Items per page (1-100). Default: 20

tools.name: ListSessions
tools.description:
List all active sessions in a sandbox with their status and recent commands.

Result set is expected to be small (typically < 10); no pagination.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: ListSnapshots
tools.description:
List available snapshots with their status and creation date.

Returns snapshot name, state, image, and resource defaults.
Response includes total count, current page, and total_pages for pagination.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (1-indexed). Default: 1

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Items per page (1-100). Default: 20

tools.name: MoveFile
tools.description: Move or rename a file or directory.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source path

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Destination path

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: ReadFile
tools.description:
Read file contents from the sandbox.

For large files, use start_line and end_line to read specific sections.
Omit both to read the entire file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: File path relative to sandbox root

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: start_line
parameters.description: First line to read (1-indexed). Default: None (start of file)

parameters.name: end_line
parameters.description: Last line to read (1-indexed, inclusive). Default: None (end of file)

tools.name: ReplaceInFiles
tools.description:
Find and replace text across multiple files.

Accepts explicit file paths and glob patterns. Glob patterns are expanded
in the tool layer before passing concrete paths to the SDK.
Returns per-file success/error status and count of files modified.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: Text or regex pattern to find

parameters.name: replacement
parameters.description: Replacement text

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: File paths or glob patterns (e.g. 'src/**/*.py'). Globs are expanded before replacing

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: ResizeSandbox
tools.description:
Resize sandbox resources. At least one param required.

CPU and memory can increase while running; disk changes require a stopped sandbox.
Disk can never decrease. GPU cannot be resized -- it is set at creation only.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

parameters.name: cpu
parameters.description: New vCPU count (1-16). While running: increase only. While stopped: increase or decrease

parameters.name: memory_gb
parameters.description: New RAM in GB (1-64). While running: increase only. While stopped: increase or decrease

parameters.name: disk_gb
parameters.description: New disk in GB (1-200). Can only increase, never decrease. Requires sandbox to be stopped

tools.name: RunCode
tools.description:
Execute code directly in the sandbox.

No shell escaping needed -- code is passed directly to the interpreter.
The language is determined by the sandbox's configured language at creation time.
Returns output, exit code, and any generated charts as metadata.

Note: Stateful execution via ``context_id`` is deferred to P1.
The SDK supports ``code_interpreter.run_code(context=...)`` but it
requires separate integration testing.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Code to execute

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: timeout_seconds
parameters.description: Max execution time in seconds (1-300). Default: 30

tools.name: RunCommand
tools.description:
Execute a shell command in the sandbox.

Use for installing packages, running scripts, or system operations.
For direct code execution, prefer run_code.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Shell command to execute

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: cwd
parameters.description: Working directory relative to sandbox root. Default: sandbox working directory

parameters.name: env
parameters.description: Extra environment variables for this command. Default: None

parameters.name: timeout_seconds
parameters.description: Max execution time in seconds (1-600). Default: 60

tools.name: RunSessionCommand
tools.description:
Execute a command inside an existing session.

For long-running commands (servers, watchers), set async_exec=True and
check output later with get_session_command_logs.

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: Session ID to execute in

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Command to execute

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: async_exec
parameters.description: Run asynchronously (don't wait for completion). Default: False

tools.name: SearchContent
tools.description:
Search file contents for a text pattern. Shell-backed using grep.

Returns matching files with line numbers (up to 50 matches per file).
Use context_lines > 0 to include surrounding lines for each match.
Supports basic regex syntax.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Text or regex pattern to search for in file contents (grep regex syntax)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Directory to search in. Default: sandbox root

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: file_pattern
parameters.description: Glob pattern to limit which files are searched (e.g. '*.py')

parameters.name: context_lines
parameters.description: Number of lines to show before and after each match (0-5). Default: 0

parameters.name: max_items
parameters.description: Maximum matching files to return (1-200). Default: 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of items to skip for pagination. Default: 0

tools.name: SendSessionInput
tools.description:
Send input to a running interactive command in a session.

Useful for commands that prompt for input (e.g., confirmation prompts).
A newline is automatically appended to the input.

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: Session ID

parameters.name: command_id
parameters.description: Command ID to send input to

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Input text to send (newline appended automatically)

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

tools.name: SetSandboxLabels
tools.description: Replace all labels on a sandbox. Useful for tagging and filtering.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Labels to set (replaces all existing labels)

tools.name: StartSandbox
tools.description: Start a stopped or archived sandbox. Returns updated sandbox info.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

tools.name: StopSandbox
tools.description: Stop a running sandbox, preserving its state for later restart.

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description:
Get the authenticated user's profile.

Returns the user ID, name, and email associated with the current API key.
Useful for confirming connectivity and identifying the API key owner.

tools.name: WriteFile
tools.description: Write content to a file in the sandbox. Creates the file and parent dirs if needed.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: File path relative to sandbox root

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: File content to write

parameters.name: sandbox
parameters.description: Sandbox name or ID. Omit to auto-select when only one sandbox exists

parameters.name: create_parents
parameters.description: Create parent directories if needed. Default: True
